name: ListDependabotAlertsForRepo
description:
Retrieve Dependabot alerts for a specific repository.

Use this tool to get a list of Dependabot alerts for a given GitHub repository. It requires an access token with `security_events` scope for private repositories or `public_repo` scope for public repositories. Ideal for monitoring security vulnerabilities in repositories.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The GitHub account owner of the repository. This name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the GitHub repository. This is case insensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: alert_states_filter
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of alert states to filter results by. Options: `dismissed`, `fixed`, `open`.

value_schema.description:
A comma-separated list of states. If specified, only alerts with these states will be returned.

Can be: `dismissed`, `fixed`, `open`

parameters.name: severity_filter
parameters.description: Provide a comma-separated list of severities: `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`. Filters alerts by these severities.

value_schema.description:
A comma-separated list of severities. If specified, only alerts with these severities will be returned.

Can be: `low`, `medium`, `high`, `critical`

parameters.name: ecosystem_filter
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of ecosystems to filter alerts by: composer, go, maven, npm, nuget, pip, pub, rubygems, rust.

value_schema.description:
A comma-separated list of ecosystems. If specified, only alerts for these ecosystems will be returned.

Can be: `composer`, `go`, `maven`, `npm`, `nuget`, `pip`, `pub`, `rubygems`, `rust`

parameters.name: package_names
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of package names. Only alerts for these packages will be returned.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of package names. If specified, only alerts for these packages will be returned.

parameters.name: manifest_paths
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of full manifest paths to filter alerts by those manifests.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of full manifest paths. If specified, only alerts for these manifests will be returned.

parameters.name: vulnerable_dependency_scope
parameters.description: Specifies the scope of the vulnerable dependency to filter alerts. Options: 'development' or 'runtime'.

value_schema.description: The scope of the vulnerable dependency. If specified, only alerts with this scope will be returned.

parameters.name: sort_by
parameters.description: Sort alerts by `created` or `updated` date. `Created` means when the alert was created, `updated` means when the alert's state last changed.

value_schema.description:
The property by which to sort the results.
`created` means when the alert was created.
`updated` means when the alert's state last changed.

parameters.name: sort_results_direction
parameters.description: Specify the order to sort the results: `asc` for ascending or `desc` for descending.

value_schema.description: The direction to sort the results by.

parameters.name: deprecated_page_number
parameters.description: **Deprecated**. Use to specify the page number of results to fetch. Prefer using `before` or `after` cursors.

value_schema.description: **Deprecated**. Page number of the results to fetch. Use cursor-based pagination with `before` or `after` instead.

parameters.name: results_per_page
parameters.description: Specifies the number of results to be returned per page, with a maximum limit of 100.

value_schema.description: The number of results per page (max 100).

parameters.name: before_cursor
parameters.description: Cursor indicating the position to fetch results before this point.

value_schema.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#link-header). If specified, the query only searches for results before this cursor.

parameters.name: cursor_after
parameters.description: A cursor to fetch results after a specified point. Helps in pagination by retrieving alerts following the given cursor position.

value_schema.description: A cursor, as given in the [Link header](https://docs.github.com/enterprise-server@3.8/rest/overview/resources-in-the-rest-api#link-header). If specified, the query only searches for results after this cursor.

parameters.name: fetch_deprecated_first_page_results
parameters.description: **Deprecated**. Number of results per page (max 100), starting from the first result. Avoid using with `last`. Use `per_page` and `after` instead.

value_schema.description:
**Deprecated**. The number of results per page (max 100), starting from the first matching result.
This parameter must not be used in combination with `last`.
Instead, use `per_page` in combination with `after` to fetch the first page of results.

parameters.name: fetch_last_page_results
parameters.description: **Deprecated**: Use `per_page` with `before` instead. Fetch results per page from the last result (max 100).

value_schema.description:
**Deprecated**. The number of results per page (max 100), starting from the last matching result.
This parameter must not be used in combination with `first`.
Instead, use `per_page` in combination with `before` to fetch the last page of results.
